The Chapter with Subhūti
The Elder Upavāna’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
who had gone to the other shore of all things,
like a mass of flames burning,
the Fully Enlightened One attained final Nibbāna.
A great crowd gathered,
and after worshipping the Realised One,
having made a beautiful memorial,
they placed the body on it.
After performing the body duties,
they divided the relics there,
and all of them, with the gods and humans,
made a memorial for the Buddha.
The first was made of gold,
the second was made of jewels;
the third was made of silver,
the fourth was made of crystal.
Likewise the fifth level,
was made of red pearls;
the sixth was made of coral,
on top of all the jewels.
The shanks were made of jewels,
the railings were made of jewels;
the memorial was completely made of gold,
rising a league into the sky.
The gods gathered there,
and together they discussed then:
“We too will make a memorial,
for the Protector of the World, the One of Great Renunciation.”
There were no extra relics,
The body was placed in one place;
In this memorial to the Buddha,
what covering shall we make?
